name: Wilderness Youth Project (WYP)

data_hints.pricing_location: Sliding scale pricing on /pricing/ page and registration portal. Six scholarship levels based on family income and size. Specific program fees listed on registration site.
data_hints.hours_location: Summer programs page has hours per program type. Most programs 9am-4pm, younger kids 9am-1pm/3pm, overnight programs vary.

extended_care.note: Other programs do not offer extended care

sessions.structure: Weekly sessions for most programs; some specialty programs 1-2 weeks

lottery_details.tip: Apply for every camp you will be available for and rank your preference to increase chances of placement
lottery_details.financial_note: Ability to pay does not affect lottery placement chances

scholarship_limits.levels_3_to_6: One session per week (school-year) or two weeks (summer) per child

pricing.note: Income limits follow California Housing and Community Development Guidelines for Santa Barbara County

summer_programs.name: Shared Roots
features: Partnered with EverWild and Ventura Wild

summer_programs.name: Ringtails Backpacking
features: First week: preparation and local exploration
Second week: backpacking expedition (max 6 hour drive from SB)

elementary.format: Van-based exploration with optional overnight options

locations.program_areas: Santa Barbara, Goleta, and Montecito wilderness areas
specific_sites: Camino Corto Open Space - grassy fields, riparian habitat, creeks
Campus Point - beach, mesa, lagoon ecosystems
Parma Park - steep grassy hills, switchback trails
San Marcos Foothills Preserve - trails, creeks
Arroyo Hondo Preserve - overnight camping site

staff.approach: Mentoring model with ongoing relationships, not one-time field trips

what_to_bring: Change of clothes (optional - kids may come home wet and dirty)

cancellation.deposit_note: $30 deposit is non-refundable on canceled registrations

policies.rainy_days: Programs operate in rain unless safety is compromised; families may keep children home if concerned
policies.illness: Keep child home if showing signs of sickness, especially fever. May return after fever-free for 24 hours without medication.

contact.address: 2040 Alameda Padre Serra, Suite 224, Santa Barbara, CA 93103
contact.alternate_address: 5386 Hollister Ave Suite D, Goleta (per some sources)

mission.statement: Foster confidence, health, and a lifelong love of learning for young people and families through active outdoor experiences and mentoring.
mission.vision: Teaching the next generation of children to be peaceful, respectful and confident stewards of our world.
mission.philosophy: All children need nature. Connection to natural environments should not be limited by economic status, race, background, or ability.
mission.approach: Ongoing mentoring relationships, not one-time field trips. Self-directed exploration, games, awareness practices, naturalist skills, inquiry-based learning, and storytelling.

equity_commitment.description: Committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice
equity_commitment.lottery_priority: Weighted lottery prioritizes returning families and DEI commitments
equity_commitment.subsidy_programs: Bridge to Nature subsidized programs offered at no cost at partner sites

site_structure.page_format: Program listings with collapsible details, separate pricing page, availability updates via blog/page
key_pages_for_scraping: /summer-programs/ - Full program list with ages, hours, descriptions
/pricing/ - Sliding scale tiers and scholarship info

scraper_hints.pricing_format: Sliding scale table on /pricing/ page with 6 levels, income thresholds for family of 4
scraper_hints.program_format: Program cards/sections on summer programs page with ages, hours, descriptions
scraper_hints.registration_dates: Look for lottery application period dates on summer programs page
scraper_hints.sessions_format: Overall summer dates listed; individual weekly sessions not typically enumerated
scraper_hints.extended_care_note: Only Bumblebees has extended care option
scraper_hints.hours_vary: Different programs have different hours - must parse per-program

special_notes: WYP uses a weighted LOTTERY registration system - this is key differentiator from first-come-first-served camps. Apply during the 1-week application window (Feb 11-18, 2026). Families receive placement notifications March 5, 2026. Maximum 3 weeks per child but typically 1-2 weeks awarded. The Salamanders program is specifically designed for neurodiverse children. Multiple overnight/expedition programs available for older kids. 76% of participants receive scholarships via automatic sliding-scale calculation during registration. Staff ratio of 4:1 is excellent. Programs visit diverse wilderness locations via van transport. The Shared Roots program is a collaboration with EverWild and Ventura Wild organizations.
